Reviews.Title: “Strange loaction, needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: TeoandTea
Reviews.Content: Fjord Hotel is reasonably priced, but has a strange location in a backyard of an industrial warehouse (Vattenfall). It takes a 15 min. walk to get to the S-banen. The staff is friendly and helpful and the morning breakfast is quite good. The rooms are generelly large with a double bed, desk and a small sofa with a coffeetable. However, the room was in a need for a total makeover. It was clean and tidy, but old fashioned with a stained carpet (ugh). The paid wifi is one of the slowest I ever have experienced at any hotel. The day I left, they were refurbishing all the rooms on the floor I stayed on. It is needed!

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressive as reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Alison6
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly reasonably priced hotel and the room was clean and secure. Those are the only positive things I can really say. The location down a side road was obscure and a 15 minute walk away from any sights. The staff were polite but not very welcoming. There were no toiletries in the room, nor any tea/coffee making facilities, no safe and no fridge. Wifi you had to pay extra for which I thought was unreasonable as most hotels it is free these days. A bottle of water set us back 4 euro 50 on the first night when we arrived as it was late and there was no other choice. The lift was slow to arrive and they even said they would charge an extra 15 euro for checking out a couple of hours later than 11am (as we had a night time flight home). It all just felt very impersonal and like they charged for any little extra they could which is very different from the attitude I have found in other hotels. In addition, the plumbing was noisy and the only English TV channel was BBC World News. Not that we were away to watch TV but still, it just added to the list of things we didn't like. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value - again!”
Reviews.Author: SeadogCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel in July 2010. I stated I would stay here again if returning to Berlin. Well I did! And it was equally brilliant and superb value (for Berlin that is – which is why I would stay here again…..). I have absolutely no complaints and would highlight the efficiency, cleanliness, outstanding (and healthy!) breakfast, and the excellent location – easy walking distance to Potsdammer Platz and Berlin Philharmonik – I was visiting to listen to violinist Joshua Bell. What a superlative concert in all respects – but that is another review in it’s own right. I prebooked the ‘businessman’s package, which included the room, breakfast and 24 hr of wi-fi – Euro 109. Again – much cheaper than hotels in that vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: hex2bin
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for a extended weekend and looked for a middle class hotel. Fjord is in my view better than a middle class hotel but as cheap as one. Excellent staff, good rooms with big flatscreen TV's and ok beds. I chose the so called "life style" room, it's a bit bigger than an ordinary room with a sofa, table and chair. The breakfast is really good if you want it, it's a bit on the expensive side though. They have a bar that's open until 22.30, when the staff goes home. That's right, no staff at night. The room key also opens the hotel front door at night. On the negative there is not much to say. A few cracks in the wall, no real minibar, just a few snacks and a few bottles on the table. Maybe the location is a little bit off, but the walking distance to nearest U-Bahn is just 10 minutes and 10 minutes more gets you to Potsdamer Platz. All in all, I liked it and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING TO DO WITH THE PICS- not recommended at all”
Reviews.Author: Gwen B
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed when I discover the Fjord hotel, the hall is nice but when I arrived at my floor I was yet smelling the disgusting smell of cold and humid cigarette coming from the old and stained carpet floor..... The room look like and English Hostal not like an Hotel. I went to the reception desk to ask if it was an error and if I really booked this room beacuse I couldn't believe it.... The staff is very nice and very helpful, they are very professional, the room was clean and the location is not bad (between Mendelssonh Bartholdy Park and Gleisdreieck U bahn stations, walking distance to Postdamer platz) but during the night there are few lights in the street and it is very dodgy. In Berlin you can find good hotels for the same price so I totally NOT recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gea11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the accommodation, only thing we missed was refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tasaar
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. It was within walking distance of most of the attractions (a longer walk, but totally doable). The staff was very friendly and our room was great. They gave us an excellent map of Berlin and showed us things to see and restaurants we might like. Clean and an affordable place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, spotless and close to the Berlin Philharmonic Concert hall”
Reviews.Author: SeadogCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here - with my 19-yr old son. Chose it because of it's reviews and close location to the Berlin Philharmonic concert hall. We were so impressed, and it was exceptional value (for Berlin - which can be very expensive). The room was superb, quiet, everything worked as it should and a pretty decent size. The staff were brilliant, efficient and helpful. The breakfast buffet is extra, but worth paying for - it is extensive, fresh and prides itself in being healthy (organic etc.). This was a memorable time, not only because of the superb concert we attended, but also because we felt we struck it 'lucky' in finding this great hotel. It also afforded us easy access to all the main Berlin tourist sites centred in and around Potzdammer Platz. If we get a another chance to visit Berlin - I would not hesitate to stay here again, assuming the reviews continue to be positive!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for moner & well located”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkClaud Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money . We paid for the 12 Euro breakfast which was also first class. Everything you could possibly want from the buffet offering. Rooms were very clean and confortable. The Hotel is in a very quite side street only 2 minute walk from Potsdammer Strasse. We walked to Potsdammer Platz in 12 minutes and to the Brandenburg Gate in 20 minutes. Two differant U-Bahn stations and lines within 10 minute walk. 2 or 3 good resturants within 5 minutes on Potsdammer Strasse if you dont want to go into town. All the staff were extremely polite, cheerfull and helpful. Would deffinately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very nice”
Reviews.Author: Broomet
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely, the staff all spoke very good english and we even got to check in at 11am in the morning as we got there earlier than planned and the room was all ready. Rooms decent size very clean. We had breakfast included with our rooms and the atmosphere downstairs is lovely, all clean and fresh. Croissants available, breakfast cereal everything you could want from a breakfast. The only thing i would watch for is when going from the airport it should be about 30 euros on the meter if you get a taxi, on the way to the hotel taxi lady ripped us off 40euros! Get the hotel staff to book you a cab back easiest way :)

Reviews.Title: “a bit out of the way but excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wilburhertfordshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 29/30 October. Good sized, clean rooms; very friendly and attentive staff. The only small minus point is that the short walk from Mendelssohn - Bartholdy Park U Bahn, although pleasant enough by day, is not very well lit by night. Having said that it's only one U Bahn stop away from Potsdamer Platz and the Philharmonie. The hotel considers itself 3 * but I think that it is much better than that. For example, the variety and quality of food on offer at breakfast beats the majority of 4 * hotels that I have stayed in across Europe. I shall certainly stay at the Fjord the next time I visit Berlin. Oh, and by the way, unlike a previous reviewer my (first ) experience of flying Easyjet was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: vasilevn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is not bad, but definitely I expected something different. The location is good, but not too close to Podstamer Platz and the U-Bahn - you have to walk 10-15 minutes, which is not so comfortable (especially with luggage). If you come for a first time, it will be good to have a printed map with you - it will help to find it. However the place is very quiet and is good for rest. The building is relatively old, but rooms are not bad, although the sound insulation is not perfect and you can hear noises from neighboring rooms. The breakfast is charged separately, but on the other hand, it's excellent - with a wide variety of food. The Internet is also paid, but may be purchased as a package with the breakfast, which is the best solution. Because we were during the Innotrans fair, prices were quite high and didn't meet the level of the hotel. In other days, the prices are normal and you can spend a good time.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel - surpringly close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel probably in the 3-star bracket. We were there when Berlin was chilly and damp but the hotel room was nice and warm. Facilities are basic - the hotel bar is staffed by the hotel receptionist who goes home at 11pm. So the bar (and the front door) shuts then as well. But when we were in the bar towards closing time, we were offered a final round of drinks and were welcome to drink these in the lobby. Nice and friendly staff and the rooms were clean and well attended to. Mendelssohn-Bartholdy Park U-Bahn is just over 5 minutes walk away - it's on line U2 so it can take you to Alexanderplatz in the east or Kudamm and Zoo in the west. Potsdammer Platz is about 10-15 minutes easy walk and the Brandenburg Gate and Unter Den Linden about 5-10 minutes from there. Didn't use breakfast as theer;s plenty of bakeries in Berlin where you can get a good breakfast much more cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit far from everything”
Reviews.Author: EstTraveller
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late - ca 1 o'clock at night. If your arrival will be also in the late hours then I firstly advise to have a mobile phone with you and also know the local area codes. Because the doors were closed and there was only a note on the door to call a certain number. Luckily we had a phone and figured also out the area codes. Calling the receptionst seemed to be the only way to check in that late. The hotel is in a very quiet neighbourhood. Literally. No restaurants, no other hotels, no subway stops nearby. The nearest bus stop is ca 200 metres away. This started to be annoying on the third day. If you would like to go back to hotel during a day (to rest/change clothes/drop off purchases etc) you would have to take long walks from a subway stop. Knowing the city bus routes (we concentrated on the subway) would probably diminish the problem. But the hotel was clean, staff friendly, rooms quite big and the price moderate for Berlin. I would consider staying there again but I would look also another options (more near the centre and/or near subway stops).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the prepayment”
Reviews.Author: malaita
Reviews.Content: The Lindemann Fjord Hotel is well located in a quiet residential street very near the Kulturforum and Potsdamer Platz. We chose it for its proximity to the Philharmonie, and Gemaldegalerie. The hotel is very clean and the staff are nice. Two grumbles, though. We were asked to pay upfront as we checked in, and the towels were rather small and thin. Otherwise, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, nice rooms, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: JeSuisAllee
Reviews.Content: Our room was surprisingly nice, larger than usual, and clean, if a bit old. There was no air conditioning, but they did provide a fan and we were never uncomfortable. There was lots of natural light. It was next to a playground and the sound of children's voices was surprisingly pleasant. It was very quiet at night, but a little disconcerting walking a very dark deserted street when returning late. It was close both to the metro and to two main bus stops and was within walking distance of the cultural center including the art museum and the Philharmonia. Potsdamer Platz, the train station and most of the sights were a short bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotell with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: SwedenHelena
Reviews.Content: Excellent and very helpful staff, always greeting you with a smile and if they did not already know the answer to our questions they immidiately looked it up for us :-) The room was really nice and clean, nothing fancy but quite allright for our modest needs - sleeping! The hotel is located close to Potsdamer Platz, it just takes 5-10 minutes to walk there and as the hotel is on a backstreet there is very little noice in the evenings/nights. We really liked the location since we like to experience our holiday cities by walking as much as possible and the hotel is a perfect starting point for exploring in all directions. The breakfast buffet was not large but quite to my liking with different yoghurts, bread(the rolls with poppyseed are very good), spreads and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Failed the most basic test”
Reviews.Author: Amentothat
Reviews.Content: It's impossible for me to rate this hotel as my stay never actually began. For the first time in many years of hotel stays, when I arrived my wife and I were told that our reservation was not being honoured as they had overbooked due to "an error with the system". (While telling us nothing could be done for us, a coachload of tourists turned up and checked in, and another guest extended his stay by another night... serious errors, I think you'll agree.) No effort had been made to contact us, directly or via Expedia, and the desk staff expected us to accept a replacement room in their sister hotel a kilometre or more further out of town. When I complained I was offered free breakfast to make up for it (wow), and only after a lot of further grief did we obtain a booking at another hotel nearer where we had originally booked. We wanted our money to go to another hotel, not reward behaviour like this. Failing to even honour your booking, and then spinning a load of old codswallop like "the system has been down from when you booked two months ago until today" is tooth-grindingly annoying and wasted a stressful hour of what was otherwise a lovely trip to Berlin. If you check reviews below you will find this hotel overbooks and bounces into the other site on a regular basis. Don't risk it, my advice is to book elsewhere, somewhere with a more healthy respect for their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, helpful, friendly - ideal”
Reviews.Author: chrisbadger
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in the Fjord hotel with my partner and both sets of parents for a city break of four nights. Hotel is ideal, staff are very friendly and helpful and we did not encounter any problems at all. As the hotel is quite small it has the advantage of being able to provide more of a personal service than larger chains and this comes across in the attitude of the staff. The location is fine, only a short walk away from places to eat and subway stations yet tucked away down a side street providing a quiet nights sleep as not on a main thoroughfare. Breakfast is again good, cereals, variety of fruit, yoghurts, breads, cheeses and cold meats, as much coffee or tea as you need to get you going in the morning. The bar area for drinks is snug and cosy and also cheaper than the restaurants we visited. Rooms are clean and comfortable as are the bathroom facilities. After reading some reviews I find some comments on the rooms etc a little strange. If you want huge rooms, satellite tv with 400 channels, thriving bar with entertainment and gold taps in the bathroom then stay somewhere else (and pay for it) Ask yourself "why do I go on holiday?" Is it to explore different places and experience different cultures or is it to spend all your time in your hotel room. I would have no hesitiation is recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK Location, Clean Functinal Rooms, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mebaka
Reviews.Content: 1. The location was only OK. About a 10-minute walk from the Arkaden Shopping Center near Potsdamer Platz. The Arkaden is a long American-style shopping mall (including two supermarkets at the southern end). From the southern end of the shopping mall, you continue thru the business center, cross the street and a canal, then walk thru a park to the hotel. The hotel is located in an area with apartment buildings. The entrance is on Bissingzelle, but if you cut thru a tiny park next to the hotel, then cut thru a bigger park across the street, you can get to Potsdamer Platz area rather quickly. The museums are close too. M. Bartholdy Park U-bahn station was also close. Sort of hard to find at first, but easy after. 2. The price was reasonable for Berlin. 3. The hotel was clean, simple, small-ish (for an American), and functional. Bathroom was a bit larger than standard in Europe. No A/C, but the window opened to the tiny park next door. 4. The front staffers were efficient, friendly and spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Berlin”
Reviews.Author: philevil82
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Lindemann Fjord, with me & my boyfriend sharing a 'King Bed' room. The hotel is very pleasant, clean & fairly modern, with helpful staff (they happily brought up new pillows for us when we found we had feather ones - allergic), and a small bar. The room we had was a good size on the first floor, with a sofa & easy chairs which we hadn't expected. The bed was (of course) not King size, but two singles pushed together, with two separate duvet covers, but it was very comfortable & cosy. They keep the rooms a bit hot, and though the windows open, on weekday mornings it is very noisy due to building work, but it didn't bother us much as it wasn't at unsociable hours (we're just late sleepers!). Shower & bathroom both very good, & there was a reasonable amount of wardrobe space, tho' it was mostly hanging space. Major let downs were the tv - all in german bar CNN (altho' Simpsons auf Deutsch is very entertaining!), and the fact that there was no tea & coffee making facilities. The water in the taps tastes a bit ick, so we found ourselves fairly thirsty - I'd recommend stocking up on bottled. The bar was small & perfectly pleasant, with very reasonably priced drinks for a hotel, so we thought. Check-out at 11am was helpful too - not too early. We didn't pay the 11E for breakfast, as there is a cafe in the Sony Centre that did a good buffet for 6.50E, but if you can't be bothered to make the walk, there is a little bakery/newsagents just on the right as you come onto Potz St. that did nice pasteries & coffee. The hotel itself is on a quiet street off Potzdamer Strasse, about 10mins stroll from Potzdamer Platz & the Sony Centre. The closest U-Bahn is Mendohlsson Bartholdy Park (about 5mins walk), we we found we used Potzdamer more as it had better connections. We had a fab 5 days in Berlin, and the hotel suited us down to the ground as it was a very good price for the standard, and was perfect for exploring the city from - not perfect, but still highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “You'll get for what you've paid for!”
Reviews.Author: francescas78
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located near Potsdamer Platz (1.3 km), it's a very simple and cheap hotel in Berlin. At the end of a small street, not well indicated, the hotel gives a first poor impression, but it's a very quiet area. There aren't many restaurant or shops around. Rooms are small, bathroom are larger. Forniture are medium-quality. Towels will not be changed during your staying, althought they're dirty and you'll left them on the floor to be changed (as in other hotel). There's only a hand-wash soap. You have to pay for everything else you need for. Rooms are cleaned every days, or it's supposed to be cleaned every day, since we noticed only a make-up of beds. Breakfast is not included, and it's expensive, since in Potsdamer Platz there're several coffee to have large breakfast at cheaper prices. There are parking outside and a indoor garage, not complimentary. Staff members are kind. It's a cheap hotel and so, you'll get what you've paid for. Next time we'll probably chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice place and great location”
Reviews.Author: maybesomeday
Reviews.Content: We have booked through expedia a stay of a week to Berlin in the week of New Year's eve. We were pleased on our arrival finding a room bright, of the correct dimensions and very clean. The hotel is central, a step away from the Neue Nationale Galerie and two from Potzdamer Platz, the Sony Center and the subway! Ghe girls of the staff are kind and polite. We did breakfast just one morning, but must admit that to the cost of 10 € I preferred to serve me to the cafe around the corner! Berlin is really beautiful in winter, all covered of snow, but needs to equip well for the cold and hope that don't blow too much wind, that makes difficult to walk afoot! Enjoy Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: mrmktr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the lindemann hotel fjord with 4 of my friends and was pleasently surprised. It is located in a very quiet area and the hotel is very clean and tidy. In good walking distance to tiergarten and to the area near the sony centre. My room was of a good size and very clean. Only downside was that it was very dark at night around the road to the hotel as the lighting was poor. With this hotel you get what you pay for and was worth the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: berriberry
Reviews.Content: Except troubles about the arrangement of rooms on the first day and the mis-handling of our booking by Expedia, the hotel was a nice place to stay and the staff have been helpful. Location is convenient and just within 10 minutes walk to the underground and Potsdamer Platz. We like the hotel surrounded by the green. Rooms are clean and nice. Curtain is a bit too thin though. Feeling comfortable to be woken up by birds’ singing and sometimes laughters of children from the park and kindergarten next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: FayeW
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Although located on a quiet side street (at least you get a decent nights sleep!) it is only 10 mins or so walk from Potsdamer Platz and close to all attractions. Everything is lovely and clean and the staff are very friendly. If you are returning after 11pm in the evening you can let yourself in with the same key as your room key no problem at all. Breakfast is lovely and is served on the 7th floor with an inside area and a terrace which was great as we were lucky to have very sunny weather. Good selection of breads, pastries, cheese, fruit, cereals etc and set us up nicely for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: whystayhome
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in the hotel's Everest triple for 3 nights. It cost only $427 [without breakfast] for the entire stay and we more than got our money's worth. As others have said, the room was spotlessly clean and the comfort level was more than adequate. We were in a wing where there was ventilation on 3 sides, so when it got a little warm, it was easy to cool down the place. I am not sure if there is air conditioning - check that for a summer stay. The location is convenient for many attrations and the bus is quite close. We were initially a little confused about finding the hotel, as the street was not on the map of Berlin in our guidebook, but it is right off Potsdamerstrasse just south of the Potsdamer Bridge. The M48 drops you half a block away or you can take the 200 bus [which connects with the airport bus at the Zoo] to Philharmonie and walk 10 minutes. The only concern I had is that if I were returning late at night by myself, the hotel's street is a quiet, not very well lit residential one and I might be a little nervous as a woman walking alone the few hundred meters off a major thouroughfare to a hotel where you need to fumble with your key to get in after 11PM. Otherwise, I can think of no drawbacks to staying here, given the price that for 3 people was more like hostel rates than a hotel tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: alan1952
Reviews.Content: Together with friends, my wife and I stayed at the Lindemann Hotel Fjord for three nights over the Easter weekend. We did get a bit lost when we arrived at the Mendelssohn-Bartholdy Park Underground Station, but soon discovered the next morning that it was only about 400 metres from our hotel and fairly central for touring around Berlin. The hotel was very clean and reasonably priced but be careful if you have a drink in the bar as we thought that the bar prices were quite high (6 euros for a standard Gin and Tonic). A good choice of buffet breakfast in a very nice and airy roof restaurant for 11 euros. All in all a very good and reasonably priced hotel that served as a very good base for touring Berlin. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieCWigan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Fjord Hotel after seeing the reviews on here. It was perfect for us, just a short walk to the Potsdamer Platz and tube station. We had originally booked 3 twin rooms but one of our friends was unable to travel so switched to a triple and a twin. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and so was the bathroom. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment but would highly recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive hotel in Berlin. My only criticism was the hotel did not respond to my emails asking for a change of room occupancy. However, this was sorted when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel In The Middle Of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: evemauve
Reviews.Content: When me and my friends decided to go to Berlin on a tight budget we didn't have the luxury to look for a hotel thorougly and decided to book hotel Fjord because of its unusual name and of course because of its price! we payed 65 euros for a double room (including breakfast) but what came as a surprise to us was the location!!! A very peaceful road very close to Potsdamer Platz , with a bus station right in the next corner!!The rooms are no luxurious but very spacious and very very clean.Breakfast was adequate enough(they even baked bread right in front of you),just what you need gain streangth!! The staff were very kind and helpful.They gave us maps of the city and information and even sell tickets for the means of transport. TIP: you don't have to use the metro since the bus routes of the city and the location of the hotel is so close to every major sight e.g.Potsdamer platz, Reihstag, Bradeburg tor , parizen platz, unter der linden,the spree river and so many more are 10 minutes on foot from the hotel.If you want to explore the city from the east to the west use the doubledeck buses 100 and 200 they practicaly take you everywhere!!And after a long day when you return to the hotel try the hotel's pub that offers you a very cosy enviroment.Berlin is such a wonderful city and when i go back I WILL DEFINATELY STAY AT HOTEL FJORD AGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thisismyreview
Reviews.Content: Very cheap (quarduple room for about £60 per night). Great service within a very clean hotel. The location is excellent - just 10 mins walk to public transport and the real hub of the city! This hotel was also particularly good to stay in around Christmas, as the local markets were brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MEG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fjord hotel on the recommendation of a German colleague. The hotel is very clean, resonably priced (triple incl. bkfst: 110 euro) and family run. The real pluses, however, are its location and the breakfast. Fjord stands at the end of a winding cul-de-sac, off the busy Potsdamer Strasse, right against a green playground. It is the first time that I enjoy such silence and secluded accommodation in a big city. It is a 5minutes walk from the main road, Potsdamer Bridge, the Mies Van Der Hohe gallery, the Staats Bilbliothek, Kulturforum and Philarmonia. Walk for 5 minutes more (or take the bus for one stop) and get to the buzzy Potsdamer Platz and the underground station that can take you anywhere. Breakfast is served on the top floor or on the terrace and it is a real feast, with anything from croissants to a selection of bread-rolls (baked on the spot), and anything from salmon to meat, from pastry to fruit etc.

HotelInfo.Name: Fjord Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Bissingzeile 13, 10785 Berlin, Germany
